statement: At my age, I’ve seen what happens when short-term economic gains are put ahead of the land, the water, and the creatures that depend on them—including us. Climate policy ought to treat environmental protection as the foundation of any healthy economy, not an optional extra, even if that means slowing or reshaping certain kinds of growth. We should invest in green jobs, conservation, and renewable energy so people can make a living without destroying the habitats and species that make life rich and livable. True prosperity is measured in clean air, safe water, and thriving ecosystems, not just in profits and GDP.
